description:
Localisation is a utility for programmers to aid the translation of text from one language to another.

A base language (usually the main language of the programmer) is selected, and secondary languages can be added or removed on the fly, with any entered text  automatically translated (where possible).

Each piece of text can be accessed by a key value in your program, and all the data can be easily read from an INI file.

This program uses Google Translation services, and whilst it can cope with a vast array of languages, it cant cope with all the included languages.  In addition, the quality of translation deteriorates when dealing with complicated sentences.  If need be, manual modification of text values can be performed.
